alert.note: Alert for Susquehanna (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 26 at 11:46AM EDT until June 26 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Binghamton has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Susquehanna County in northeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 245 PM EDT. * At 1146 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain has already fallen and more heavy rainfall is expected over the next hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Susquehanna, Susquehanna Depot, Harford, New Milford, Lanesboro, Hop Bottom, Gibson, Jackson, Dimock, Alford, Lakeside, Lakeview, West Lenox, Hickory Grove and South Montrose. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
